page.title: 13Pennington:Historic Building
page.content: Pennington Church was first built in the twelth century.Inside the church is a stone called a tympaneum.The tympaneum was used as a window lintel at Beckside Farm for many years. The writing tells us that the church was given by Gamel de Pennington.Other twelth century remains are the font and Fria. Fria is a goddess of fertility.The church was dedicated to St.Leonard.Later the church was dedicated to St.Michael and the Holy Angels.The ancient stocks may still be seen at the side gate. Swarthmoor Hall is 400 years old.It is famous for its connection with the Quaker George Fox.The dining-room has a CumberlandSlate floor and oak- panelled walls.The staircase has a unique four-poster Newell post.They say a"grey lady"has been seen on the stairs.
